入場人數 50037

由於87分鐘late goal搞到人都醒晒 所以講吓場波

中場中兩位絕對係踢得出色。先講Valero，睇落唔搶眼，無killer pass、無遠射或較炮，但控制節奏做得真係好好。同光頭佬之前所講一樣，佢10球傳波有9球成功，亦都做到嘅反擊第一點。第二點域仙奴都唔差，今場護球工作唔差，有嘗試帶波推波換取空間。

可惜嘅係進攻第三點好差，通常運到上中前場就會交比邊路，左邊Dalbert個人失誤太多，衝唔過、傳唔到，又易逼甩，總之去到佢到就會失。而P44今場好多時靠近中路／右路協攻，所以左路死晒。右路問題都唔多講，簡達華比上季多咗切入中路而唔落底傳中，可能係好事，但佢好多基本波都傳失，諗唔到點做就斬...

而照道理係做第三／四點嘅B77就會企係對方附近唔知做乜鳩，都唔知可以點傳比你，但佢後上射門嘅能力真係國米中場最好果件，所以史巴揀佢正選都合理。B77現身嘅位置太差，呢個情況喺Eder入替後改善咗，佢好勤力跑動同現身，攻到邊都有佢嘅身影。

驚喜係今場有兩翼換位嘅情況出現，C87罕有地打左路，呢種情況翼鋒通常會cut入中路，但我地係比人封實晒，一次都cut唔到，最後又係打回原形，hehe...伊卡迪都係同一個問題，唔洗場場都講了。

國米再勝下游球隊　光頭佬嫌踢得太慢！



本輪意甲賽事（1/10）中，國米以2比1擊敗賓尼雲圖，對陣下游隊再贏一場。對此勝仗，光頭佬史巴列堤亦感到相當滿意：「我對於大家嘅表現深感自豪，但仍有啲地方係需要改善。」

「比賽階段有時我地唔夠集中，導致基本錯誤頻生，好在球員有正確態度應付，我地並無當正自己贏硬。當我地控制咗場面，想話整多粒嘅時候，對面就入咗波。」呢啲真係抵鬧，但光頭佬咁都搵到位讚，都幾好波。

之但係贏波還贏波，有錯就必須認！光頭佬又再重覆上次賽後嘅批評，嫌國米踢得太慢：「呢場波睇到好多正面效果，但始終唔夠穩定性。不過Keep住落去就岩啦！我地控制到大局，但我地一定要保持高速度踢法，唔能夠無啦啦又慢咗落嚟 當然啦，比起上季嚟講，呢班波係進步緊嘅！」

對於贏波功臣波索域B77，光頭佬一樣非常高興：「波叔係個高汁球員，佢今日踢前鋒身後，踢得非常出色。好幸運地，國米有唔同嘅球員能夠勝任呢個位置，有得比我輪換吓。」被問到會否變陣踢雙前鋒，光頭佬亦覺得未嘗不可：「Why not? 擺多個前鋒幫伊卡迪都係一個選擇，咁樣我地可以入多啲波添。不過呢，球隊嘅平衡先係最重要嘅！」

可惜啊，係就係幾個都踢到攻中，但踢到唔代表踢得好，難得波索域成功，希望都保持到啦！

Forza Inter!

自2002年，國際米蘭首次取得開季七戰19分成績。

賓尼雲圖成為意甲史上第三隊首七戰全敗嘅球隊。

國米暫成本屆意甲攻入最多頭搥嘅球隊，一共四球。

波索域完成咗佢喺意甲第二次梅開二度，第一次係2016年對陣熱拿亞；同時佢入咗意甲生涯第一粒頭搥。

國米對上一次死球直入係今年三月份，班尼加攻入阿特蘭大。

本場賽事中，國米嘅傳球成功率為90.7%，暫時係本屆意甲最高。

Roberto Carlos confirms he only left Inter because of Roy Hodgson, a tactician who “doesn’t know much about football.”

“Hodgson's stay at Inter destroyed me,” Roberto Carlos told planetfootball.

“He played me in midfield and I had to consider that there was a chance that this would ruin my career in the national side.

“It's not that I did not have a good relationship with Hodgson. It is just that Hodgson doesn't know much about football.

“When Inter lost in the UEFA Cup final against Schalke in 1996, it was purely because of Hodgson.”

Roberto Carlos had a considerably better rapport with Italian Coach Fabio Capello, who brought him to Real Madrid.

“Fabio Capello was different - so different - and when I moved to Madrid I did it because of him. He is the most important Coach I have had in my life.”

Few put more determination into the Derby della Madonnina for Inter, but Marco Materazzi admits his son is a Milan fan. “The shame…”

The San Siro showdown is on Sunday at 19.45 UK time (18.45 GMT), click here for a match preview.

“My son Davide has always been a contrarian in everything. That time, he went too far,” Matrix told La Gazzetta dello Sport.

“The day before the derby, I had an appointment at the Pinetina training ground and first went via a Nike exhibit on art in football, so I asked Davide to come with me.

“I get to the door to leave the house and I find him standing there wearing a Milan jersey with the number 23 and Materazzi written on the back. It was a gift Massimo Ambrosini gave him, who was very entertained when learning he’d got it into his head to support Milan.

“I begged Davide not to go out with me like that, but he was six and a half years old and refused. I had to walk around Milan for three hours with him like that, the day before a decisive derby. We were challenging for the Scudetto that Sunday.

“It was more or less a nightmare. I am not someone who is easily embarrassed, but that day it was a struggle. All the stares from people whispering ‘Materazzi has gone mad,’ a few Milanisti who were laughing, and I just had to shrug. I couldn’t find the words. The shame…”

That wasn’t the only time Davide got Materazzi into trouble in a Derby della Madonnina.

“On his fifth birthday, I scored a goal in the game we won 4-3 and I showed the shirt I had on underneath to the whole stadium. I was sent off and drove the Inter lawyer crazy. He begged me to explain in the appeal that I wasn’t mocking the Milan fans with my exaggerated celebration and was not trying to provoke anybody.

“When I got there, I told the judges: ‘I did it because they’ve been calling me a son of a bitch for years. Plus I’d promised it to my son.’ The €10,000 fine was reduced to €5,000.”

Spalletti:

“We made the most of certain situations. When Vincenzo Montella says Milan had a very good second half, that is true, but at that point they were forcing the situation and Borini no longer came back to help the defence, while the strikers stayed up there. If you can in that situation get the ball to Ivan Perisic and push the wingers up, you are more likely to score a goal.

“Milan passed it around well and forced us to change our attitude, as at one stage we had to move to three at the back, as Milan were changing the play to their fifth on the right and that made it difficult for us. They kept putting that ball through into the penalty area, as we were always late getting there with the full-backs.

“The Rossoneri ran a few risks and gave us chances to score, but we also settled into it and got the measure of them.”

Livaja: ‘I want to score against Milan’

AEK Athens forward Marko Livaja wants to score against Milan tonight because “I’m in love with Inter”.

The Croatian was on the Nerazzurri’s books from 2011 to 2013, scoring four goals in six games in the Europa League group stage in 2012.

“I’m an Interista, I’m in love with Inter,” Livaja explained to Gazzetta dello Sport.

“That’s where I started, and I scored my first goals at San Siro. I had to leave to grow, because at 18 it’s hard to play much in a team like that.

“Inter remain in my heart though, so I have even more reason to want to score against Milan.”

Agent of Chile star confirms Inter talks

Serie A giants Inter Milan are keeping tabs on San Lorenzo star Paulo Diaz and will look to fight for his signature soon, reports suggest.

The 23-year-old Chilean, who is represented by FIFA agent Shalimar Reynal, is already a full-blooded Chile international, having made eight senior appearances since making a debut back in 2015.

Reynal has opened up Inter’s interest in his client. He said: " I know Inter is handling it ."

Talking about a clause in his contract, he said: " San Lorenzo is willing to give it. There is also a rescission clause in his contract, so he can leave.

“From my point of view he can become a nerazzurri as early as in January. Diaz has a profile suitable for European football and one of his goals is a transfer to Europe and he also prefers other destinations such as MLS. "

Diaz joined San Lorenzo from Colo-colo back in 2016 and the defender has made over 40 appearances for the first-team since then.

The 23-year-old Chilean, who is represented by FIFA agent Shalimar Reynal, is already a full-blooded Chile international, having made eight senior appearances since making a debut back in 2015.

Reynal has opened up Inter’s interest in his client. He said: " I know Inter is handling it ."

Talking about a clause in his contract, he said: " San Lorenzo is willing to give it. There is also a rescission clause in his contract, so he can leave.

“From my point of view he can become a nerazzurri as early as in January. Diaz has a profile suitable for European football and one of his goals is a transfer to Europe and he also prefers other destinations such as MLS. "

Diaz joined San Lorenzo from Colo-colo back in 2016 and the defender has made over 40 appearances for the first-team since then.

史巴列堤：幸運遇上國米


意甲榜首大戰，國米際蘭成功以0：0逼和拿玻里，喺聖保羅球場取得重要一分。國米保住第二位之餘，更加中止咗拿玻里嘅連勝紀錄，而兩球隊於今屆意甲賽事中均保持不敗。

國米主帥光頭佬對球隊表現相當滿意，更加對球員讚不絕口：「我喺到向球員致敬！面對強勁嘅對手，我地依然超水準。球員知道自己要做乜同埋目標係乜。今場我地都帶有運氣，但計我話，能夠帶領到呢一班球員，先至係我最大嘅福氣。」

雖然如此，史巴列堤亦覺得球隊有進步空間：「如果要深入分析賽事，會見到我地嘅反擊做得唔夠好，控球在腳時處理不佳，同埋某啲情況下，我地被對手製造咗不少麻煩。因此我地要盡快改善，因為其他球隊已經追緊上嚟，佢地甚至已經好出色。」

「技術上，我地絕唔輸蝕比對手，我地都有高汁嘅球員。例如漢丹又再救咗國米一鋪，佢同連拿都打得好。不過點都好啦，好高興能夠取得呢個成績。」

「正因為我地不比拿玻里弱，當與其他球隊對壘時，我地要繼續保持呢個強勢。不過我地踢落果陣要更有決定性同埋組織性。呢方面拿玻里做得好好，因為佢地有更多時間磨合。但我相信今晚嘅得著遠大於呢一分。」

光頭佬都好幽默咁讚賞對手：「高列巴尼（Koulibaly）知道點樣突破史堅尼亞，但對米蘭達就唔得。我會問吓佢點做到... 」

史巴列堤：我好興奮牙！


國際米蘭喺主場領先3球，即使於比賽末段被森多利亞連追兩球亦不改戰果，藍黑以3：2獲勝。

國米於上半場發揮神勇，更被對方主帥形容為「近五年最佳表現」，受到咁多讚賞，光頭佬亦毫不諱言：「我真係好興奮！唔係因為個排名（暫時榜首），而係球隊表現令我爽死了！球員非常專業，佢地值得受到大家嘅關注。」

「對手係勁旅，有個好高汁嘅教練，將兩個機會轉化成入球。但咁都唔代表我地踢得差。我地預計到會好難踢，因為打完拿玻里三日就打森多係絕不容易。所有球員都好落力，我真係好榮幸教到呢班波，國米Fans都應該以佢地為榮！」

史巴列堤同我國就好似情人一樣，對對方讚不絕口。被問到陣容深度不足被視為今季最大障礙，光頭佬一樣覺得無問題：「昔日嘅辛頓會重現眼前，同時戴爾拔有啲疲態，佢仲適應緊球隊，但佢會成為一個好強嘅球員。而因為我收起咗域仙奴，我要有一定制空力嘅球員，所以我選擇咗辛頓。艾達同蘭奴亦都係有質素嘅球員。JM有啲身體問題無踢到打吡，同埋未有參與正常訓練。簡些路都未達到100%，佢斬波果陣扭傷而且感受到痛楚，我唔可以放佢打閘，因為佢咁樣嘅情況唔可以作出攔截。」

施多夫ig po咗條片講佢同國米

Former Nerazzurri midfielder Clarence Seedorf opened up on his transfer from Real Madrid to Inter in the 1999-2000 season.

“I heard that the club was discussing my transfer with some other clubs – Roma, Arsenal and Manchester United. The club needed money so we decided to part ways.”

“I got the phone call from Marcello Lippi. I was in Rio de Janeiro on holiday at that point – he woke me up actually – I said, ‘Hello, who is this?”

Speaking further on ‘that’ phone call with his soon to be coach he added, “Lippi said I want you to come to Inter and play behind Ronaldo and Vieri. I said, ‘Can you say that again? Give me just five minutes, I will pack my stuff, I am coming.'”

“I accepted; I went to Italy a few days later and started my journey with Inter. It was short, but amazing.”

國米官方：股東大會詳情

今日國米召開股東大會，通過咗2016/17年度財政報告，球會收入有大幅增長。

收入方面，上一財政年度共有318.2m歐元收益，比上上年多咗78.4m歐元，即係有32.7%升幅。Earning Before Interest Taxes Depreciation and Amortization（稅息折舊攤銷前利潤）達67.5m，營運損失下降至24.6m歐元，比上上年進步咗36.7m歐元。

簡單而言就係財政大幅改善，而同時國米2016/17營運損失滿足FFP所設標準，準備比UEFA通過。

MILAN – The FC Internazionale Milano S.p.A. Shareholders’ Meeting has today approved the 2016/17 financial statements, underlining the club's significant growth.

The consolidated financial statement shows revenue of €318.2m, an increase of €78.4m or 32.7% on the previous financial year, generating an EBITDA of €67.5m and a further reduction in operating losses, which fell to €24.6m, a €36.7m improvement on last year.

For the club the operating losses satisfy the Financial Fair Play regulations for the 2016/17 tax year (pending formal approval from UEFA).

The process aimed at turning the club around is still in progress, but the desired results are already being obtained thanks to careful planning by the ownership and the excellent development prospects created as a result. The club must remain highly focused in order to continue to develop new revenues and ensure improved economic efficiency while at the same time aiming for its primary objective of returning to the level at which it has traditionally belonged.

FC Internazionale Milano S.p.A. CEO Alessandro Antonello had the following to say about the positive results obtained in the 2016/17 financial year.

"Thanks to the hard work of everyone at the club and commercial growth we have ensured these positive figures for 2016/17. The underlying trend is one of growth and sustainability as we concentrate on returning Inter to highest level of European football. All of our actions so far are part of our plan to make the team more competitive and turn our club into a model for sporting success."

In addition to approving the financial statements ending on 30 June 2017, the Shareholders’ Meeting also approved the composition of the Board of Directors. Alessandro Antonello was confirmed as CEO, having been co-opted by the Board of Directors in August.

The full make-up of the Inter Board of Directors is as follows: Erick Thohir, Handy Purnomo Soetedjo, Nicola Volpi, Alessandro Antonello, Yang Yang, Mi Xin, Zhang Kangyang, Ren Jun, Liu Jun.

伊卡迪：阿祖安奴令我成為藍黑人


日前伊卡迪接受意大利雜誌《Rivista Undici》嘅訪問，談及到佢嘅過去、現在同未來計劃。

【伊卡迪與國米的恩與怨】

相信好多人都因為阿祖安奴而認識、鍾意國際米蘭，伊卡迪亦為呢位Shot Power 99 對國米著迷：「我細個已經係國米球迷（Interista），我打機成日都揀國米。而我揀國米係因為前鋒有阿祖安奴，我真係好迷佢。當時我仲係細蚊仔，但已經係國米球迷了。」


之不過呢，伊卡迪最欣賞嘅國米球員並唔係阿祖安奴，而係為足球創造咗歷史嘅朗拿度。至於點解會加盟國米？原來因為一個人......

伊卡迪：「當年莫拉堤好喜歡我，而且係眾多球會之中，佢係最想得到我。即使有幾困難，佢都堅持從森多利亞簽走我。」

早兩年伊卡迪出咗一本名為《Sempre Avanti》嘅自傳，向國米激進球迷「北看台」（Curva Nord）開火，並揚要將球迷殺死，令雙方關係勢成水火。佢再被問到呢件事嘅睇法：「自傳風波？我已經解釋清楚，無補充啦。球迷好愛國米，我都想球隊同球迷得到最好嘅回報。成件事搞到我好煩好反感，但呢單嘢已經完結咗。」  


【最佳開局迎接新球季】



今季取得比三冠王時期更佳嘅開局，伊卡迪就認為國米絕對值得支持：「呢啲唔係運氣嚟，我地好努力改變咗好多嘢。教練非常僅慎，我地有共同嘅目標，由球會、主席，以至所有嘅球迷都要求我地達到呢個目標：我地要踢歐冠！」  

「仲記得上季3月，我地踢完國際賽之後，個個都有啲迷失。果時我真係好嬲，返到屋企個心情都係好差。」  

雖然年資尚淺，卻被委任為藍黑隊長，究竟係咪適合佢？伊卡迪回應相當簡潔：「做隊長唔難，我有做隊長嘅特性。呢個係我嘅任務，而且我引以自豪。」


【瘋狂的轉會市場，110m夠唔夠？】

打咗幾季好波，國米Fans對伊卡迪嘅轉會緋聞應該見慣不怪，究竟呢啲傳聞係流定堅？

伊卡迪：「舊年拿玻里想撬我，經理人亦同佢地傾過。舊年的確有啲混亂，但我一直都好冷靜，一直都有全力協助國米。我會留喺國米好耐，我想著住呢件波衫贏冠軍。」  

而伊卡迪合約入面有110m歐元違約金，喺依加嘅轉會市場似乎變得微不足道。之但係伊卡迪都好淡定：「經過上一個轉會窗，110m違約金的確唔夠。我會同球會討論吓呢樣嘢，不過佢地都知我嘅意向係點。」

【退休要做好老公　專心做份湊仔工】

好多人掛靴後嘅生活都離不開足球，最接近我地嘅例子當然係國米副主席J.辛尼迪。不過伊卡迪似乎就唔係好想退役後留喺呢個足球嘅花花世界：「4張嘢果時會做乜？我唔係托迪，我掛靴之後唔想再留喺足球世界。我鐘意踢波，但一啲都唔想做教練或者球會高層。我淨係想匿埋喺屋企全職爸爸！」

【國米風頭躉　盡受抨擊隊長】

伊卡迪行事出位，一直都受到唔少人批評，其中一位就係口水多過浪花嘅馬勒當拿。但對於呢位前球王嘅「意見」，伊卡迪只係好冷淡咁答：「我上季已經回應過佢，就係咁。」  

講到佢同老婆嘅戀情，個個都會諗到麥斯盧比斯。伊卡迪卻只談她的好：「屋企嘅事乜都由佢做晒。佢要湊仔女返學，幫佢搞生日會，又乜又剩咁。我盡量做好本份，幫到嘅都會幫。佢好出名，啲人好鐘意談論佢，但我地絕對唔會理。我知道佢好就得。」  「我地唔係一見鐘情，係認識咗一年先開始。」  

伊卡迪已經成堆仔女，生多幾件可以踢7人場，但隊長似乎無乜時間同佢地玩：「我地好享受米蘭嘅生活。我啲仔喺米蘭已經有好多朋友。好違憾我唔能夠陪成日佢地，總係有取捨嘅......」


有咩事令佢後悔，佢就話：「我本自傳最後一Part為我製造咗好多麻煩......果件事對所有人都唔好，我真好愛國米......」

究竟呢位惹火隊長可唔可以同球迷破冰？我相信只要繼續有好表現，以及保持呢份忠誠同熱血，終有一日，伊卡迪會征服北看台。
伊卡迪！啪啪啪！伊卡迪！啪啪啪！

The Nerazzurri held their shareholders’ meeting today to approve the budget for 2016-17, with more details revealed about the summer transfer campaign of 2016.

Gabriel Barbosa, known as Gabigol, cost €33.5m to sign from Santos, with agent fees of €3.6m.

The Brazilian failed to make a single Serie A start for the Beneamata, scoring just once, and has since been loaned to Benfica with an option to buy.

Gabigol has played 26 minutes for Benfica so far.

In August 2017, after his first competitive appearance of the season, Inter were obligated to buy Gagliardini from Atalanta for €24.1m.

It was also revealed that Joao Mario cost €44m in total, and Antonio Candreva €23.6m.

Inter’s accounts reveal how they kept hold of Ivan Perisic, despite interest from Manchester United.

The Nerazzurri had to raise €35m by August this year to comply with UEFA’s Financial Fair Play, or be sanctioned by European football’s governing body.

As a result, the Red Devils made an offer of €35m for the winger, well below the €55m asking price, reasoning that the Beneamata would cave.

However, the club managed to keep hold of Perisic by selling other players, with the shareholders’ meeting today revealing they brought in €44m.

Gianluca Carpari went to Sampdoria for €15m, generating a profit of €9.3m, while Juan Jesus brought in €6.8m when his move to Roma was made permanent.

Fabio Guelfi’s €6m move to Atalanta brought in €4.8m, with the sales of Cristiano Biraghi and Diego Laxalt generating a further €9m for the club.

Add the sales of Ever Banega, Andrew Gravillon, Federico Dimarco, Senna Miangue, and Daniel Bessa and the total far exceeds the €35m Inter needed.

These accounts don’t include purchases or sales for August, so the signings of Dalbet, Borja Valero, Milan Skriniar and Matias Vecino aren’t included.

Inter have already sold 65,000 tickets for Sunday’s match with Torino, so they could eventually attract 70,000 fans.

The Nerazzurri have made their best ever start to a Serie A season, at least in the era of three points for a win, winning nine games and drawing two of the first 11.

Today the club’s Twitter account has announced that 65,000 tickets have been sold, so even the top tiers are now on sale.

That’s likely to mean an attendance of around 70,000 on Sunday.

The Derby della Madonnina drew 78,000 but that was boosted by the Milan attendance.

In addition, Inter-Torino isn’t seen as one of Serie A’s biggest games.

Valero: ‘Inter a step forward’

Borja Valero feels he made “a step forward” in joining Inter, but admits he wanted to finish his career at Fiorentina.

The midfielder left the Viola in the summer to join the Nerazzurri, but it was suggested at the time he was being forced out.

“[Sporting director] Pantaleo Corvino had a different way of thinking to me,” Valero explained to Marca Plus.

“We didn’t see eye-to-eye and the relationship broke down. I couldn’t stay in a place where I didn’t agree with the person who was my boss, so I decided to listen the various offers.

“[Inter Coach Luciano] Spalletti was the one who insisted on me, he gave me a lot of confidence.

“It wasn’t a question of money, if that was the case I’d have gone to China last Christmas, they offered me three times what Inter did.

“I left on good terms with the Fiorentina fans because they understood my position. I was honest with them and when things went badly they were always by my side. But I took it for granted I’d end my career in Florence.

“The idea of leaving the city caused me something that was almost vertigo. I came out of my comfort zone, but then that was also a motivation for the change because people think a player of age is on the wane.

“Instead, by coming to Inter, I took a step forward.

“It’s very different to Fiorentina, there are huge expectations but there have been no trophies for several years.

“There’s a lot of pressure, and I have to adapt to that.

“I might be in my best form right now. The body has its limits, but I think I’m in great form.”
